page.title: 06Low Valley Farm
page.content: Low Valley farm is about 300 years old. It has got about 82 acres of land. The farm is rented from the Coal Board and Middlewood Hall Trust. The present farmers have lived on the farm for 29 years.The only animals kept on the farm are heifers and calves. They have 6 tractors and numerous pieces of machinery. A lot of damage is done by vandals. They start fires and throw rubbish in the fields. One cow swallowed some litter and died. They use the land for grazing and crops. They grow barley and wheat. The grain is ground for cattle food. The Mine opposite will soon be closed and the site will be returned to farmland, making the farm 150 acres.The farmer is hoping to continue to live here but the N.C.B.may put the land up for sale.
